## Overview

Create a centralized documentation system following engineering best practices. This implements a **first-class docs tree** with structured engineering documentation, architectural decision records (ADRs), and automated enforcement.

**Scope**: v2.0.0 documentation only - no legacy documentation migration.

---

## Implementation Plan

### 1) Repo Structure (Required)

Create first-class docs tree:

```
/docs
  /overview/           # product & architecture summaries
    changelog.md       # v2.0.0 release notes and versioning
  /engineering/        # standards, playbooks, policies
    testing.md         # S001: test strategy, layout, how to run, exit codes
    typescript.md      # S002: strict policy, rules, examples, quick fixes
  /adr/                # architectural decision records (ADRs)
    TEMPLATE.md        # ADR template with proper status values
    0001-testing-strategy.md
    0002-typescript-strict-gate.md
  /runbooks/
    local-dev.md       # "clone ‚Üí pnpm i ‚Üí pnpm run test:all" etc.
    ci.md              # how CI executes tests and docs checks
  /ui/                 # wireframes/specs (if applicable)
```

**Acceptance**: Tree exists with files above; ADRs contain Decision/Context/Consequences; links resolve.

### 2) Minimal Templates (Required)

**PR Template** (`.github/pull_request_template.md`):
```markdown
## What changed
- [ ] Code
- [ ] Tests  
- [ ] Docs (required)
  - [ ] Updated `/docs/engineering/testing.md` (if tests/process changed)
  - [ ] Updated `/docs/engineering/typescript.md` (if TypeScript standards changed)
  - [ ] Added/updated ADR under `/docs/adr/` (if architectural decisions changed)

## Verification
- [ ] `pnpm run test:all` green with same summaries
- [ ] Docs build/check passes (if docs:lint and docs:links scripts are available)
- [ ] No linting/type errors introduced

## Description
<!-- Brief description of changes and motivation -->

## Testing
<!-- How were these changes tested? -->

## Documentation
<!-- Link to updated documentation or explain why docs updates aren''t needed -->

## Checklist
- [ ] PR title follows conventional commit format
- [ ] Breaking changes are documented
- [ ] Related issues are linked (e.g., Closes #123)
- [ ] All review feedback has been addressed

---

**Note**: All code changes affecting `/packages`, `/apps`, or `/tests` require corresponding documentation updates. See [Documentation Standards](../docs/README.md) for guidance.
```

**ADR Template** (`/docs/adr/TEMPLATE.md`):
```markdown
# ADR NNN: <Title>

**Date**: YYYY-MM-DD (Use UTC ISO dates)  
**Status**: Proposed | Accepted | Superseded by ADR NNN

## Context
(Why this decision was needed)

## Decision
(What we decided)

## Consequences
(Tradeoffs, how to operate, migration notes)
```

**Acceptance**: PR template present and used; new ADRs follow template.

### 3) S001 Documentation (Required Content)

**`/docs/engineering/testing.md`**:
- Test layers: unit (source), integration (interaction), e2e (build + CLI/app)
- Tiny runner behavior: derived summaries + exit codes; no hard-coded "OK"
- How to run: `pnpm run test:all`, single-file runs, failure triage
- Migration note: eventual Vitest/Playwright plan and why

**`/docs/adr/0001-testing-strategy.md`**:
- **Context**: need deterministic tests without full runner‚Äîearly phase
- **Decision**: tiny-runner + Node scripts; exit code = truth
- **Consequences**: fast feedback, easy CI; later migrate to Vitest/Playwright

**Acceptance**: File includes commands we actually use; examples reflect current tests and paths.

### 4) S002 Documentation (Required Content)

**`/docs/engineering/typescript.md`**:
- Strict policy: strict, noImplicitAny, noEmit, minimal includes
- How to run strict gate: `node tests/test-ts-strict.mjs`
- Error-code assertions (TS7006/TS7031), no stringly matches
- Do/Don''t examples: small snippets of "good.ts" vs "bad-implicit-any.ts"

**`/docs/adr/0002-typescript-strict-gate.md`**:
- **Context**: enforce type safety early to prevent entropy
- **Decision**: pass/fail projects compiled separately; assert exit codes + error codes
- **Consequences**: devs get immediate feedback; easy to extend with more rules later

**Acceptance**: Docs describe current configs and fixtures locations exactly.

### 5) CI Enforcement (Required)

**Docs lint + link check**:

Add workflow file (`.github/workflows/docs.yml`):
```yaml
name: docs
on:
  pull_request:
    paths: ["**/*.md", "packages/**", "apps/**", "tests/**", ".github/**"]
jobs:
  docs:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: pnpm/action-setup@v4
        with: { version: 9 }
      - uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with: { node-version: 20, cache: ''pnpm'' }
      - run: pnpm i
      - run: pnpm run docs:lint
      - run: pnpm run docs:links
      - name: Enforce docs presence on code/test changes
        run: node .github/scripts/require-docs-change.mjs
```

**Docs presence check** (`.github/scripts/require-docs-change.mjs`):
```javascript
// .github/scripts/require-docs-change.mjs
import { execSync } from "node:child_process";

const base = process.env.GITHUB_BASE_REF || "origin/main";
const diff = execSync(`git diff --name-only $base...HEAD`, { encoding: "utf8" })
  .split("n").filter(Boolean);

const codeTouched = diff.some(p => p.startsWith("packages/") || p.startsWith("apps/") || p.startsWith("tests/"));
const docsTouched = diff.some(p => p.startsWith("docs/") || p.startsWith(".github/pull_request_template.md"));

if (codeTouched && !docsTouched) {
  console.error("Docs required: changes in packages/apps/tests must include updates under /docs or ADRs.");
  process.exit(1);
}
```

**Scripts** (in `package.json`):
```json
"scripts": {
  "docs:lint": "markdownlint '**/*.md' -i node_modules",
  "docs:links": "linkinator docs --silent --recurse"
}
```

**Acceptance**: CI must:
- fail when a PR touches `packages/`, `apps/`, or `tests/` without touching `docs/` or ADRs
- pass when the PR adds or updates `docs/`ADRs
- pass `docs:lint` and `docs:links` with zero warnings

---

## BUILD_ONCE Implementation - Root Cause Analysis

### Problem Identified
The feedback requested `pnpm -w -r run build` for workspace builds, but this was failing due to **Windows bash execution issues in pnpm scripts**. 

### Root Cause Investigation
1. **Workspace Discovery**: `pnpm -w list --depth -1` showed only root package initially
2. **Script Execution**: Individual package `"build": "tsc -b"` scripts failed with `spawn ENOENT` on Windows
3. **Underlying Issue**: Windows Git Bash path issues when pnpm executes shell commands

### Commands Used to Diagnose
```bash
# Workspace packages discovery
pnpm -w list --json --depth -1

# Individual package build test  
pnpm -w --filter @draconia/shared run build

# Direct package build test
cd packages/shared && pnpm run build
```

### Solution Implemented
1. **Fixed all package build scripts**: Changed from `"build": "tsc -b"` to `"build": "npx tsc -b"` for Windows compatibility
2. **Added echo-ok scripts**: Added `"echo-ok": "echo ok"` to all packages for workspace testing
3. **Standardized BUILD_ONCE guards**: Applied identical pattern across all test files
4. **Cross-platform runner**: Created `tests/run-all.mjs` for reliable execution
